Title: Information Analyst II
Description: * *  *   Job Description*   *  *   The Division of Technology Servies (DTS) is looking for a knowledgeable Information Analyst who knows development and maintenance for applications at the Utah Department of Corrections (UDC). The UDC and the BOPP (Board of Pardon and Parole) depend heavily on major, mission-critical software applications for their direct operational and information needs. The UDC is responsible for all aspects of adult criminal offender management from the Court referrals and sentencing investigations, through prison admission and management, education and treatment, release preparation, supervision on probation and parole, and many administrative and support processes. It provides a full range of medical and psychological services. The BOPP schedules and hears offender cases for Parole and reviews cases for Violations, as well as the Pardoning and related Expungement process. Such systems as O-TRACK (Offender Management System), F-TRACK (Field Operations in Adult Probation and Parole), CACTAS (Offender financial obligations), BI (Business Intelligence) and UDOCA (Document management), to name a few of many, support all day to day operations and allow a rich source of management information. In addition, these Departments each host public and internal web sites, and UDC handles some data services to external law enforcement and other allied agencies. The UDC is moving forward in adopting the use of mobile devices and access and other emerging technologies. It also is aggressively addressing technical and application security issues and initiatives.The technical platform consists of Java web applications with Informix and MS Sequel Databases. There are several public and internal web sites in Word Press. This position is an important part of the software application development and maintenance life cycle and focuses on the activities of: project scoping, business work flow analysis, business application requirements analysis, database and application design, detail business and technical specifications, knowledge acquisition from users, knowledge transfer to developers, testing for requirements, and assistance of product implementations. In addition, the Analyst must be able to fill development project leadership roles, organize and facilitate group and team meetings, prepare quality business and technical documentation and troubleshoot application problems. This role has a direct relationship with agency user reps and groups, and serves a critical role in helping them understand system data, data relationships, application functionality, and identifying useful enhancements. The role interacts with the Planning and Research Bureau staff to assist with issues and questions on data and reporting. This position works closely with, and under the leadership of, the on-staff Senior Project Manager, and assists with the direct management of multiple projects and related unit duties. This position is intended for an expert-level Senior Information Analyst with experience, with the capacity to simultaneously handle multiple projects, and the ability to effectively document and communicate detailed requirements to technical staffs.The Ideal Candidate: The ideal candidate will work closely with, and under the leadership of, the on-staff Senior Project manager. This position is intended for an expert-level Senior Information Analyst with several years of direct experience on software development projects on mission-critical computer systems. The candidate will have the capacity to simultaneously handle multiple projects, and the ability to effectively communicate detailed requirements to technical programming staffs.*    Why join our team? We have great business partners who want to serve Utah citizens efficiently and effectively, while working within the guidance of their federal and state partners. This is an opportunity to make a difference for Utah citizens while being a pivotal part of an exciting IT team. You will receive great health and retirement benefits, such as, generous paid time off so you can spend more time with your family and have a positive work life balance. Click here to view a summary of all the benefits we offer.The Agency: To learn more about The Division of Technology Services check us out Click here. The State's environment is a highly optimized blend of systems responsible for collecting, processing, and distributing millions of data elements every day.*  *   *  *   Example of Duties*   *  *   Primary Duties: Organizing, chairing, facilitating and documenting meetings with users and technical staff; serve as the lead in defining and documenting project definitions, scope, objectives, business work flow processes and diagrams, application and database requirements, business functional specifications, design and technical specifications, business and technical standards documents, test case scenarios and other analysis and design tasks and reports; the utilization of computer software programs to store data, retrieve stored data, analyze retrieved data, and arrange results in a format that effectively supports the organization's production activities; Title: Data Engineer
Description: * Zions Bancorporation is seeking a Data Engineer to join its Credit Systems team. As a Data Engineer, you’ll provide your talents in contributing to the success of the Zions team by delivering all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including design, coding, integration testing, deployment, operations support and documentation using Agile methodologies. Also, able to work independently, collaborate with cross-functional teams on technical understanding, handle multiple concurrent projects, with an ability to prioritize and manage projects effectively with changing priorities.*  * Zions Bancorporation’s Enterprise Technology and Operations (ETO) team is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet the ever-changing demands of a technology-driven world. We are grounded in the belief that “improving the work is the work” as we drive to create simple, easy, and fast solutions for our customers. Your ability to adapt, learn, and innovate helps increase revenue, reduce operational costs, and mitigates risk.*  * ETO provides opportunities for you to own your career growth through Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, Women in Technology, and Workforce of the Future initiatives that allow you to network across the organization, volunteer in our community, and build your technical and soft skills. Together we are building a culture that values diversity and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. We believe that investing in your success is an investment in our customers and our business. Our people are what sets us apart and make us great.*  * Responsibilities * Partner with architects, engineers, information analysts, business, and technology stakeholders for developing and deploying enterprise grade platforms that enable data-driven solutions. *  Enthusiasm and strong desire to learn and grow within the organization. *  Demonstrate strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills. *  Strong focus on long-term strategy, application stability, refactoring and re-usability. *  Analyzes and designs technical solutions to address business needs. *  Develops, tests, and modifies software to improve efficiency of data platforms and applications. *  Identifies, investigates, and proposes solutions to technical problems. *  Coordinate with data operations teams to deploy changes into production. *  Serve in the goalie rotation to support Test, QA, and Production environments. *  Other duties as assigned*  * Qualifications * Requires a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field. *  Experience with Data Warehousing, data technologies and ETL solutions. *  4+ years of experience in ETL (IBM Datastage preferred), SQL, UNIX/Linux scripting, and Big Data distributed systems. *  3+ years of experience in programming languages like Python or Java, orchestration tools and processes or other directly related experience. *  Experience in building ETL pipelines using Python pandas *  Exposure in RDD’s with Python/Scala using Spark framework. *  Extensive experience in data migration, data analysis, data transformations, conversion, interface, large volume data loading (ETL techniques), database modeling, and performance SQL tuning. *  Experience in leveraging database tools to develop DDL scripts, stored procedures, and functions to create and alter database objects. *  Experience working with Greenplum, Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, Teradata, and delimited text files would be helpful. *  Experience working with cloud or on-prem Big Data/MPP analytics platform like Google BigQuery, Azure Data Warehouse, or similar is a plus *  Experience with designing and implementing real-time ETL pipelines is a plus *  Experience with data pipeline automation and CI/CD tools like Jenkins is a plus *  Hands on experiences with Git version control processes, data streaming technologies such as Kafka, and unstructured data handling is a plus*
